posts.title: Highlighting the College and Career Pathways' ICCAN Teens
posts.text: The program assists students with many facets of the college and career application process. Applications for the 2021-22 school year are open now.

posts.title: A Booklist to Learn About Historically Black Colleges and Universities
posts.text: These titles will help you gain a better understanding of the necessity for HBCUs, what it's like to attend one, and how they've impacted our society and culture.

posts.title: Thriller Genre Primer
posts.text: A genre expert defines the genre for you, tell you about sub-genres, and gives you some titles to read and recommend. ​

posts.title: Hamilton Grange Library Hosts Graphic Novelist Joel Christian Gill
posts.text: On September 16, Hamilton Grange had the exceptional honor of hosting an author visit with graphic novelist Joel Christian Gill at the New Heights Academy Charter School.

posts.title: Kwame Alexander Visits the Hamilton Grange Library
posts.text: Kwame Alexander's visit came less than a week after his most recent novel, The Crossover, became the recipient of the 2015 Newbery Medal, the American Library Association’s the top award given to "the most distinguished contribution to American literature for children."

posts.title: Great Historical Fiction for Teens, Just in Time for Autumn!
posts.text: I don't know what it is about autumn but it puts me in the mood for history. Inspired by Octavian Nothing, here is a list of other historical fiction for teens.

posts.title: My Favorite Sesame Street Clip: Kermit and Joey Say the Alphabet
posts.text: To this day, I laugh when I see it. It's so endearing to me, for a few reasons.

posts.title: What Was on Your High School English Reading List?
posts.text: It feels like it's been a long, long, long time since I've sat in a high school English class. I remember them really well, though.
